title: Material Classification Instructional Design: Social Scientific Inquiry Using Multiple Intelligence-Based Constructivist Teaching Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced coursework and extensive professional field experience, foundational understanding of social science phenomenon analysis
context.additional_context: Emphasizes developing educational materials and experimental designs for pre-service teachers, with the goal of fostering civic rights and responsibility through integrated science-social studies education.

learning_goals: Preservice teachers design instructional materials for classifying states of matter (solid/liquid/gas) based on multiple intelligence theory, linking them to socio-scientific contexts (e.g., resource distribution, environmental issues).
Learners complete concept map and digital animation projects using a constructivist approach, analyzing the relationship between scientific inquiry and social application through this process.

Instructional designers develop activity worksheets to reinforce science process skills (observation, classification, reasoning) and social studies core competencies (critical thinking, problem-solving).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
